BiblioData.Title: Decoding of array sensors with microspheres
BiblioData.Abstract: The invention relates to compositions and methods for decoding microsphere array sensors, and to array compositions comprising at least a first and a second subpopulation of microspheres which are labelled with a different nucleic acid.

Claims.P: 1. An array composition comprising:
a) a substrate with a surface comprising discrete sites; and

b) a population of microspheres distributed on the surface at the discrete sites, said microspheres comprising at least a first and a second subpopulation, wherein each subpopulation of microspheres comprises a different nucleic acid, said nucleic acid capable of binding decoder probes in order to identify the sequence of the nucleic acid.
2. A composition according to claim 1, wherein at least one decoder probe is bound to said nucleic acid.
3. A composition according to claim 1, wherein a plurality of decoder probes is bound to said nucleic acid.
4. A composition according to any one of the preceding claims, wherein the microspheres in said first and second subpopulations lack a unique optical signature.
5. A method of making an array composition comprising:
a) forming a surface comprising individual sites on a substrate; and

b) distributing microspheres on said surface so that said individual sites contain microspheres, wherein said microspheres comprise at least a first and a second subpopulation, each subpopulation of microspheres comprising a different nucleic acid, said nucleic acid capable of binding decoder probes in order to identify the sequence of the nucleic acid.
6. A method according to claim 5, wherein said microspheres are randomly distributed on said surface.
7. A method according to claim 5 or claim 6, wherein said individual sites are depressions.
8. A method according to any one of claims 5 to 7 further comprising applying energy to said array composition.
9. A method of decoding an array composition comprising:
a) providing an array composition comprising:
i) a substrate with a surface comprising discrete sites; and

ii) a population of microspheres distributed on said surface at said discrete sites, said population of microspheres comprising at least a first and a second subpopulation, each subpopulation of microspheres comprising a different nucleic acid, said nucleic acid capable of binding decoder probes in order to identify the sequence of the nucleic acid;
b) adding a plurality of decoder probes to said array composition, wherein the decoder probes bind to the nucleic acid; and
c) detecting the decoder probes, thereby decoding the array composition.
10. A method according to claim 9, wherein said decoder probes are directly or indirectly labeled, and wherein decoding the array composition comprises detecting the presence of the label.
11. A method according to claim 9 or claim 10, wherein said microspheres in said first and second subpopulations lack a unique optical signature.

12. A method according to any one of claims 9 to 11, wherein said plurality of decoder probes are added to said array composition in a sequential series of decoding steps, and wherein said sequential series of decoding steps generates a unique code for each nucleic acid.
13. A method according to any one of claims 9 to 12, wherein the location of microspheres of the first subpopulation is determined.
14. A method according to claim 13, wherein the location of microspheres of the second subpopulation is determined.
15. A method according to any one of claims 9 to 14, wherein said microspheres are randomly distributed on said surface.
